SWAT.utilities.common

Class RollBackManger

  • java.lang.Object
    • SWAT.utilities.common.RollBackManger

  • public class RollBackManger
extends java.lang.Object
    RollBackManager is a utility that allows the user to backup some files and restore the original file later. SWAT model, for example, could potentially contain hundreds of files. For example in one of the project I was involved, the SWAT model contained more than 190K files. This utility, i.e. RollBackManager allows you to change the SWAT files during your run; however, keep a copy of the original files. Later, you could give a call to this utility and restore the files to their original state prior to the changes.
    Author:
    Mohammad Abouali

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RollBackManger()
      default constructor, setting the source folder to the current path and the back folder to backupFolder within the current path.
      RollBackManger(java.lang.String defaultSrcFolder)
      Sets the default source folder to the provided one and the backup folder is set to backupFolder within the default source folder.
      RollBackManger(java.lang.String defaultSrcFolder, java.lang.String backupFolder)
      Sets both the default source folder and backup folder to those provided by the user.

    • Field Detail

      • defaultSourceFolder

        private java.lang.String defaultSourceFolder
        It stores the default source folder. The default value is the current folder.

      • backupFolder

        private java.lang.String backupFolder
        It stores the location of the backup folder. The default value is the a folder called "BackupFolder" within the sourceFolder.

      • isBackupFolderAvailable

        private boolean isBackupFolderAvailable
        Tracks whether the backup folder is already created. It can not be changed once some files are backed up.

      • fileList

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fileList
        A map from original file path to its backup. The key is the absolute path to the original location of the file and the value is the absolute path to the where it was backed up.

      • setBackupFolder

        public RollBackManger setBackupFolder(java.lang.String backupFolder)
        Changes/sets the backup folder. It only works if there is no file already backed up, i.e. the file list is empty. If the fileList is not empty any attempt to change the backup folder will results in throwing an error.
        Parameters:
        backupFolder -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error

      • prepareBackupFolder

        public RollBackManger prepareBackupFolder()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Checks whether the back folder exists or not. If not, it creates one.
        Returns:

      • backup

        public RollBackManger backup(java.lang.String parentFolder,
                             java.lang.String filename,
                             boolean forceBackup)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        It will back up the file that is within the parent folder.
        Parameters:
        parentFolder -
        filename -
        forceBackup - if it is set to true, the file is backed up even if it was already backed up. If it is set to false, and the file is already backed up it won't be copied again to the backup folder but an error message is printed; however, no exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • rollBack

        public RollBackManger rollBack(java.lang.String parentFolder,
                               java.lang.String filename,
                               boolean deleteBackup)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        If the file is backed up it is restored. Otherwise, it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        parentFolder - original parent folder name for the file to be restored
        filename - the filename
        deleteBackup - If set to true the backup of the file will be deleted and removed from the list.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
